meanings.definition: The condition of being a serf.
meanings.sent1: In the past, many people lived in serfages and had to work for the landowners.
meanings.sent2: The serfages in the village worked hard in the fields every day.
meanings.sent3: The serfages decided to start a club for people who enjoy farming.
meanings.sent4: The serfages were like pieces on a chessboard, moved by the landowners.
meanings.sent5: The image of the serfages toiling in the fields under the hot sun stayed with him.

meanings.definition: The collective body of serfs on a particular estate.
meanings.sent1: The serfages on the estate gathered together for a meeting.
meanings.sent2: The serfages worked together to harvest the crops before winter.
meanings.sent3: The serfages organized a bake sale to raise money for new tools.
meanings.sent4: The serfages were like a close-knit family, supporting each other through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the serfages working side by side painted a picture of unity and cooperation.
